title: Heal study core metadata template schema

Minimal Info.title: Minimal info element schema
Minimal Info.description: Minimal info element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.study_name: The title or name of the study. For NIH-funded studies, this will generally be equivalent to the NIH application ID title.
propertyDescriptions.study_description: A description of or abstract for the study. For NIH-funded studies, this will generally be equivalent to the NIH application ID abstract text.
propertyDescriptions.study_nickname: Study nickname, alternative title, abbreviation, or acronym (e.g. many people shorten the name of the HEAL Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development study to ABCD).

study_description.schema:name: study_description

Metadata Location.title: Metadata location element schema
Metadata Location.description: Metadata location element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.8b748149-dbe4-423c-9076-951a67cfc930: The name of the repository in which data and metadata will be stored
propertyDescriptions.other-study-associated-websites: Any other websites or landing pages associated with this study. Please enter the links in URL format.
propertyDescriptions.nih_application_id: NIH application ID; only applicable if study is funded by NIH
propertyDescriptions.nih_reporter_link: URL link to the NIH application ID NIH RePORTER webpage; only applicable if study is funded by NIH
propertyDescriptions.clinical_trials_study_ID: ClinicalTrials.gov study ID; only applicable if study is a reportable clinical trial and registered on ClinicalTrials.gov
propertyDescriptions.cedar_study_level_metadata_template_inst: ID of the CEDAR HEAL Study-level Core Metadata Template instance created for this study
propertyDescriptions.Data Repositories: Describes the data repositories to which data or other shareable products produced by the study will be submitted by the study authors and stored for long-term access; one item in this array per repository.

items.title: Data Repositories field schema
items.description: Data Repositories field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.repository_name: Name of a repository in which data or other shareable research products are submitted for storage by study author.
propertyDescriptions.repository_study_ID: Unique identifier assigned to the study at that repository; usually a number or combination of standard letters and numbers (e.g. study identifiers on ClinicalTrials.gov are generally in the format: NCT12345678).
propertyDescriptions.repository_persistent_ID: Unique persistent identifier assigned to the study at that repository; usually a DOI
propertyDescriptions.repository_citation: The official citation the repository requests be used to cite the study/data when the study/data is discovered/accessed via the repository; will likely follow the format: Principal Investigator(s). Title. Place-of-Distribution and Distributor, Date-of-Distribution. DOI. version (where distributor will be the repository name).

Title. Place-of-Distribution and Distributor, Date-of-Distribution. DOI. version (where distributor will be the repository name).

Citation.title: Citation element schema
Citation.description: Citation element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.study_collections: If this study belongs to a study group or collection(s), this is the name or identifier of the study group or collection(s) (e.g. SAMHSA performs a survey called the National Survey of Substance Abuse Treatment Services (N-SSATS) every year; each annual survey may be registered as a separate study that belongs to a collection called the N-SSATS collection).
propertyDescriptions.Funding: Describe the grants and other funding supporting the study; one item in this array per grant/award or funding source
propertyDescriptions.Investigators: Describe the primary and co-investigators of the study; one item in this array per investigator.
propertyDescriptions.heal_funded_status: Whether or not the study is funded by the NIH HEAL initiative.
propertyDescriptions.study_collection_status: Whether or not the study is related to a study group or collection(s) by some administrative mechanism, or belongs to a group or collection of studies (e.g. SAMHSA performs a survey called the National Survey of Substance Abuse Treatment Services (N-SSATS) every year; each annual survey may be registered as a separate study that belongs to a collection called the N-SSATS collection).

items.skos:prefLabel: Name of the study group or collection(s) to which this study belongs

items.title: Funding field schema
items.description: Funding field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.funder_name: Name of a the granting agency or organization funding the study; include sub-agency administrative entity as second element in array if applicable (e.g. National Institute of Health, National Institute on Drug Abuse)
propertyDescriptions.funder_abbreviation: Abbreviation for the name of the granting agency or organization funding the study; include abbreviation for sub-agency administrative entity as second element in array if applicable (e.g. NIH, NIDA).
propertyDescriptions.funder_type: Type of granting agency or organization funding the study
propertyDescriptions.funder_geographic_reach: The geographic reach of the granting agency or organization funding the study.
propertyDescriptions.funding_award_id: The grant award ID or number. For NIH-funded studies this will be the project or award number and is distinct from the NIH application ID.
propertyDescriptions.funding_award_name: The grant award name. For NIH-funded studies this will be the project or award name and is distinct from the name or title associated with the NIH application ID.

Data Availability.title: Data availability element schema
Data Availability.description: Data availability element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.data_available: If study will collect/produce data, indicate whether all, some, or none of the data will be made available
propertyDescriptions.data_collection_status: If study will collect/produce data, indicate whether the study has not started, has started, or has finished data collection/production activities
propertyDescriptions.data_release_status: If the study will collect/produce data and make at least some of the data available, indicate whether the study has not started, has started, or has finished data release activities.
propertyDescriptions.data_collection_start_date: If the study will collect/produce data, indicate the anticipated date when data collection/production will begin
propertyDescriptions.data_collection_finish_date: If the study will collect/produce data, indicate the anticipated date when data collection/production will end (data collection/production is complete).
propertyDescriptions.data_release_start_date: If study will collect/produce data and make at least some of the data available, indicate the anticipated date when first data will be released.
propertyDescriptions.data_release_finish_date: If study will produce data and make at least some of the data available, indicate the anticipated date when last data will be released (data release is complete).
propertyDescriptions.data_restricted: If study will collect/produce data, and make at least some of that data available, indicate whether all, some, or none of the data will have restriction(s) on access beyond acknowledgement and signing of a minimal DSA
propertyDescriptions.produce_other: Indicate whether or not the study will produce shareable products other than data.
propertyDescriptions.produce_data: Indicate whether or not the study will collect/produce (primary or secondary) data.

Findings.title: Findings element schema
Findings.description: Findings element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.primary_publications: List of the doi for any/all primary study publications that use the study data; include any papers, books, articles, blog posts, etc. authored by the investigators or team responsible for the study; one item in this array per publication/doi.
propertyDescriptions.secondary_publications: List of the doi for any/all secondary study publications that use the study data; include any papers, books, articles, blog posts, etc. authored by persons OTHER THAN the investigators or team responsible for the study; one item in this array per publication/doi.
propertyDescriptions.primary_study_findings: Simple, one-sentence take-away conclusion(s) from study author publications; one item in this array per single-sentence conclusion (e.g. item #1: Provision of MAT rx to men with documented OUD leaving jail reduces overdose risk by 9%; item #2: Provision of MAT rx plus case management support to men with documented OUD leaving jail reduces overdose risk by 30%; item 3: Provision of MAT rx plus case management support to men with documented OUD leaving jail is more effective than provision of MAT rx alone at reducing risk of OUD overdose).

items.title: primary_publications field schema
items.description: primary_publications field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18
items.schema:name: primary_publications
items.schema:description: List of the doi for any/all primary study publications that use the study data; include any papers, books, articles, blog posts, etc. authored by the investigators or team responsible for the study; one item in this array per publication/doi.
items.skos:prefLabel: Primary Publications DOI

items.title: secondary_publications field schema
items.description: secondary_publications field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18
items.schema:name: secondary_publications
items.schema:description: List of the doi for any/all secondary study publications that use the study data; include any papers, books, articles, blog posts, etc. authored by persons OTHER THAN the investigators or team responsible for the study; one item in this array per publication/doi.
items.skos:prefLabel: Secondary Publications DOI

items.title: primary_study_findings field schema
items.description: primary_study_findings field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18
items.schema:name: primary_study_findings
items.schema:description: Simple, one-sentence take-away conclusion(s) from study author publications; one item in this array per single-sentence conclusion (e.g. item #1: Provision of MAT rx to men with documented OUD leaving jail reduces overdose risk by 9%; item #2: Provision of MAT rx plus case management support to men with documented OUD leaving jail reduces overdose risk by 30%; item 3: Provision of MAT rx plus case management support to men with documented OUD leaving jail is more effective than provision of MAT rx alone at reducing risk of OUD overdose).
items.skos:prefLabel: Primary Study Findings

Findings.schema:name: Findings

Study Translation Focus.title: Study translation focus element schema
Study Translation Focus.description: Study translation focus element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.study_translation_focus: Whether the study is primarily focused on learning more about a human opioid or pain CONDITION or on discovering, or learning more about a TREATMENT, intervention, or solution for a human opioid or pain condition. This may be quite simple to infer for human subject studies. For studies not involving human subjects, please consider how/where the study will most substantially contribute to the HEAL Initiative translational purpose of learning more about human opioid and pain conditions and driving development of solutions to these conditions. Choose one.
propertyDescriptions.study_translational_topic_grouping: What types of determinants and/or mechanisms related to human opioid use or pain conditions is the study investigating and/or measuring (e.g. A study investigating differential pain/nociception signaling in persons living in neighborhoods with high versus low social cohesion might choose both 'Biology and Health' and 'Social Determinants'). Choose as many as apply.

study_translation_focus.title: study_translation_focus field schema
study_translation_focus.description: study_translation_focus field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18
study_translation_focus.schema:name: study_translation_focus
study_translation_focus.schema:description: Whether the study is primarily focused on learning more about a human opioid or pain CONDITION or on discovering, or learning more about a TREATMENT, intervention, or solution for a human opioid or pain condition. This may be quite simple to infer for human subject studies. For studies not involving human subjects, please consider how/where the study will most substantially contribute to the HEAL Initiative translational purpose of learning more about human opioid and pain conditions and driving development of solutions to these conditions. Choose one.

items.title: study_translational_topic_grouping field schema
items.description: study_translational_topic_grouping field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18
items.schema:name: study_translational_topic_grouping
items.schema:description: What types of determinants and/or mechanisms related to human opioid use or pain conditions is the study investigating and/or measuring (e.g. A study investigating differential pain/nociception signaling in persons living in neighborhoods with high versus low social cohesion might choose both 'Biology and Health' and 'Social Determinants'). Choose as many as apply.
items.skos:prefLabel: Types of determinants/mechanisms the study is investigating

Study Translation Focus.schema:name: Study Translation Focus

Study Type.title: Study type element schema
Study Type.description: Study type element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.study_stage: The category of research being conducted
propertyDescriptions.study_primary_or_secondary: Is the study collecting data itself to analyze and draw conclusions or is it leveraging data collected by other entities to analyze and draw conclusions.
propertyDescriptions.study_observational_or_experimental: Whether the study is observational (no explicit intervention) or experimental (some explicit intervention).
propertyDescriptions.study_subject_type: What is the actual species or entity that is experimentally or observationally studied in the research; each HEAL study will have translational relevance to humans, but not all HEAL studies directly study humans.
propertyDescriptions.study_type_design: The overarching study type and more granular study design. Choose as many as apply.

study_stage.description: study_stage field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

study_stage.schema:description: The category of research being conducted

Study Type.schema:name: Study Type

Human Treatment Apply.title: Human treatment apply element schema
Human Treatment Apply.description: Human treatment apply element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.treatment_investigation_stage_or_type: If the study is investigating a treatment, intervention, or solution to a human opioid or pain condition, what type of investigation is the study undertaking?
propertyDescriptions.treatment_mode: Is the treatment, intervention, or solution that my study is relevant to meant to prevent the occurrance of a condition (e.g. development of a non-opioid drug for pain to prevent opioid exposure and addiction, case management and MAT for pregnant women to prevent in utero exposure to opioids, safe needle exchange center to prevent spread of blood borne diseases among people using heroin), treat an occurrance of a condition (e.g. naloxone to treat opioid overdose, physical therapy to treat existing pain from a back injury) , and/or is it a harm reduction mechanism (e.g. safe needle exchange reduces harm associated with heroin addiction/use, decriminalization of heroin possession or use reduces the harm associated with heroin addiction/use)
propertyDescriptions.treatment_application_level: Is the treatment, intervention, or solution that my study is relevant to applied at the individual level (e.g. a doctor prescribes a drug or physical therapy regimen to a patient) or at the population/community/group level (e.g. a city changes good samaritan naloxone laws, or implements a safe needle exchange center, or adds park maintenance resources to the budget to provide more access to outside places to exercise)?
propertyDescriptions.treatment_type: Classify the treatment, intervention, or solution the study is relevant to by broad type of intervention. Choose as many as apply
propertyDescriptions.treatment_novelty: Is the treatment, intervention, or solution that my study is relevant to totally novel, is it totally established, does it have some element of novelty added to an established intervention (novel added to established, established used in a novel population, setting, or combination)?

Human Treatment Apply.schema:name: Human Treatment Apply

Human Condition Apply.title: Human condition apply element schema
Human Condition Apply.description: Human condition apply element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.condition_category: Considering the study in a translational context, to humans with which broad category(ies) of opioid use or pain conditions are the study results intended to apply. Choose as many as apply.
propertyDescriptions.condition_investigation_stage_or_type: Each HEAL study will be doing work that is relevant to a human opioid and/or pain condition. What does this study intend to learn about the condition? If the study is investigating a treatment, intervention, or solution, please choose 'Treatment of Condition'. Choose as many as apply.
propertyDescriptions.pain_causal_condition: If the study will be doing work that is relevant to a human PAIN condition category, is the study focusing on pain caused by a specific condition? e.g. Cancer, fibromyalgia, arthritis, occupational injury, sports injury, car accident, surgical procedure. If yes, please indicate the causal condition(s) here - Values will be restricted to NLM MeSH Diseases - see Branch 'C' here: https://meshb-prev.nlm.nih.gov/treeView
propertyDescriptions.pain_treatment_or_study_target_condition: If the study will be doing work that is relevant to a human PAIN condition category, and the pain condition has a causal condition (specified above), is the study focusing its investigation on the causal condition, or on the pain resulting from the causal condition? e.g. In a study of effective treatments for fibromyalgia/fibromyalgia pain, is the study focused on fibromyalgia disease-modifying treatments, or on treatments that address the symptomology of pain? Choose as many as apply.
propertyDescriptions.all_treatment_or_study_target_condition: Considering the study in a translational context, to humans with which detailed type of opioid use or pain conditions are the study results intended to apply? Each HEAL study will be doing work that is relevant to a human opioid and/or pain condition; You indicated the broad category of condition(s) the study is focusing on or relevant to above. Here, please indicate the study focus condition(s) in detail. Choose as many as apply - Values will be restricted to NLM MeSH Diseases - see Branch 'C' here: https://meshb-prev.nlm.nih.gov/treeView
propertyDescriptions.all_outcome_condition: If the outcome condition(s) the study hopes to impact or measure is different than the treatment or study target condition (e.g. testing a disease-modifying fibromyaligia treatment but measuring depression, physical and social function, and neurologic pain such as headaches as the main outcomes). Please indicate the study outcome condition(s) here. Choose as many as apply - Values will be restricted to NLM MeSH Diseases - see Branch 'C' here: https://meshb-prev.nlm.nih.gov/treeView
propertyDescriptions.all_other_condition: If the study is measuring or tracking other human health conditions besides the treatment or study target condition and outcome condition, please indicate the other tracked/measured condition(s) here. Choose as many as apply - Values will be restricted to NLM MeSH Diseases - see Branch 'C' here: https://meshb-prev.nlm.nih.gov/treeView

Human Subjects Apply.description: Human subjects apply element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.gender_applicability: Considering the study in a translational context, to humans of which gender identity(ies) are the study results intended to apply and/or likely to generalize to
propertyDescriptions.sexual_identity_applicability: Considering the study in a translational context, to humans of which sexual identity(ies) are the study results intended to apply and/or likely to generalize to
propertyDescriptions.geographic_applicability: For studies with human subjects, from which geographic location(s) are subjects recruited. If subjects are recruited in the US nationally, choose only US - national. If subject are recruited in the US only in specific state(s), choose US - Specific States, then please also select the abbreviation of each of the specific states from which subjects are recruited. If subjects are recruited in the US from specific county(ies) within specific state(s), please choose US - Specific States and US - Specific Counties, and choose the abbreviation of each specific state from which subjects are recruited
propertyDescriptions.irb_vulnerability_conditions_applicabili: Considering the study in a translational context, which special IRB human vulnerability conditions are the study results intended to address or apply to?
propertyDescriptions.age_applicability: Considering the study in a translational context, to humans of which age or developmental stage are the study results intended to apply and/or likely to generalize to.

Data.title: Data element schema
Data.description: Data element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.18

propertyDescriptions.subject_data_unit_of_collection: For studies with human subjects, is the data collected at the individual or population level?
propertyDescriptions.subject_data_unit_of_analysis: For studies with human subjects, is the data analyzed at the individual or population level?
propertyDescriptions.subject_data_level_available: For studies with human subjects that will make at least some data available, will data be made available at the individual subject level or some level of aggregation?
propertyDescriptions.subject_data_unit_of_collection_expected: For studies with human subjects, what is the expected number of subjects for which data will be collected? If unit of data collection is individuals this is the expected number of individuals, and if the unit of data collection is populations/clusters this is the expected number of populations/clusters.
propertyDescriptions.subject_data_unit_of_analysis_expected_n: For studies with human subjects, what is the expected number of subjects at the level at which data will be analyzed? If unit of data analysis is individuals this is the expected number of individuals, and if the unit of data analysis is populations/clusters this is the expected number of populations/clusters.
propertyDescriptions.subject_geographic_data_level_collected: For studies with human subjects, will geographic data be collected? if so, what level of geographic detail will be collected?
propertyDescriptions.subject_geographic_data_level_available: For studies with human subjects that collect geographic data and will make at least some data available, will geographic data be made available? if so, what level of geographic detail will be made available?
propertyDescriptions.data_orientation: Does the study produce/collect quantitative data?, qualitative data? Choose as many as apply.
propertyDescriptions.data_type: What is the type of the data the study will produce/collect. Choose as many as apply.
propertyDescriptions.data_source: What is the source of the data the study will produce/collect. Choose as many as apply.

propertyDescriptions.Contacts: Describe the contact person(s) for the study. This is the person(s) who should be contacted for questions about the study; will be auto-set as NIH contact PI(s) if NIH-funded; one item in this array per contact person.
propertyDescriptions.Contacts and Registrants: Describe the contact person(s) for the study. This is the person(s) who should be contacted for questions about the study; will be auto-set as NIH contact PI(s) if NIH-funded; one item in this array per contact person.
propertyDescriptions.Registrants: Describe the person(s) who will register the study on the HEAL Platform. This person(s) must be authorized to access the study registration page/process on the HEAL Platform; will be auto-set as NIH contact PI(s) if NIH-funded; one item in this array per registrant.
